paper_abstract: The recent Maximum Weighted Likelihood (MWL) [18], [19] has provided a general learning paradigm for density-mixture model selection and learning, in which weight design, however, is a key issue. This paper will therefore explore such a design, and through which a heuristic extended Expectation-Maximization (X-EM) algorithm is presented accordingly. Unlike the EM algorithm [1], the X-EM algorithm is able to perform model selection by fading the redundant components out from a density mixture, meanwhile estimating the model parameters appropriately. The numerical simulations demonstrate the efficacy of our algorithm.
paper_title: On weight design of maximum weighted likelihood and an extended EM algorithm
